revised_title: The Role of the Diaphragm in Respiration and its Interactions with Other Muscles
tldr: The author examines the role of the diaphragm in respiration and its interactions with other muscles, such as the intercostal muscles and serratus magnus. The study highlights the importance of the diaphragm's passive tension in retaining supplemental air in the lungs, restoring equilibrium, and maintaining pericardial space. The author also refutes common misconceptions about abdominal and thoracic breathing in males and females.
